timeline.message:
implement `/eth/v1/beacon/headers/:block_id` endpoint

 - this is not similar to other pre-existing endpoints, so nothing was deprecated with this change.

 partially addresses #2760

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

implement `/eth/v1/beacon/headers` query parameter slot

 - search by parent root will be treated separately.

 partially addresses #2760

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

timeline.bodyText: While not particularly useful, it's probably more typical to accept both params and treat it as an AND condition - so return only blocks at the specified slot with the specified parent root.
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: the spec was super poorly defined... though we could do that, i'd probably just search on slot given our data structures?
replies.author: rolfyone

replies.bodyText: Yeah, search on slot then filter to check it matches the parentRoot supplied.
replies.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: Interesting question if the API is supposed to always default a head slot actually.  Maybe if you specify just parentRoot it should return blocks for the head slot that have the specified parent root which would be an awful lot easier to implement.  Not sure it means that but worth logging and issue to get it clarified and the docs updated.
replies.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText:
nit: Maybe extract this to a local slotToLoad variable as the chaining gets a bit confusing otherwise.  And maybe:
slot.or(recentChainData::getCurrentSlot).orElseThrow()?
timeline.author: ajsutton
